overview:
## Overview

A *dynamic item* is any iOS or custom object that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem] protocol. The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionViewLayoutAttributes] classes implement this protocol starting in iOS 7.0. You can implement this protocol to use a dynamic animator with custom objects for such purposes as reacting to rotation or position changes computed by an animator—an instance of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicAnimator] class.

This parent class, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior], is inherited by the primitive dynamic behavior classes [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAttachmentBehavior], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollisionBehavior], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGravityBehavior], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItemBehavior], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPushBehavior], and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISnapBehavior].

You can subclass [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior]. By using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/addChildBehavior(_:)] method in an instance of this class or in a custom subclass, you can create composite behaviors of your own design.

When you subclass [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior], you typically need to provide one or more initializers, along with other housekeeping methods such as those implemented in the iOS primitive dynamic behaviors.

To perform per-step logic in a dynamic animation, provide a block object using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/action] property.

To access the dynamic animator that a dynamic behavior is associated with, use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/dynamicAnimator] property. To respond to a dynamic behavior being added to or removed from a dynamic animator, implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/willMove(to:)] method.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior
crawled: 2025-12-04T10:19:32Z
---

# UIDynamicBehavior

**Class**

An object that confers a behavioral configuration on one or more dynamic items, for their participation in 2D animation.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIDynamicBehavior
```

## Overview

A *dynamic item* is any iOS or custom object that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItem] protocol. The [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionViewLayoutAttributes] classes implement this protocol starting in iOS 7.0. You can implement this protocol to use a dynamic animator with custom objects for such purposes as reacting to rotation or position changes computed by an animator—an instance of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicAnimator] class.

This parent class, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior], is inherited by the primitive dynamic behavior classes [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIAttachmentBehavior], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollisionBehavior], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGravityBehavior], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicItemBehavior], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPushBehavior], and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISnapBehavior].

You can subclass [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior]. By using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/addChildBehavior(_:)] method in an instance of this class or in a custom subclass, you can create composite behaviors of your own design.

When you subclass [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior], you typically need to provide one or more initializers, along with other housekeeping methods such as those implemented in the iOS primitive dynamic behaviors.

To perform per-step logic in a dynamic animation, provide a block object using the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/action] property.

To access the dynamic animator that a dynamic behavior is associated with, use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/dynamicAnimator] property. To respond to a dynamic behavior being added to or removed from a dynamic animator, implement the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIDynamicBehavior/willMove(to:)] method.

## Configuring a dynamic behavior

- **action**: The block you want to execute during dynamic animation.
- **addChildBehavior(_:)**: Adds a dynamic behavior, as a child, to a custom dynamic behavior.
- **childBehaviors**: Returns the array of dynamic behaviors that are children of a custom dynamic behavior.
- **removeChildBehavior(_:)**: Removes a child dynamic behavior from a custom dynamic behavior.

## Responding to changes in the behavior tree

- **dynamicAnimator**: The dynamic animator that the dynamic behavior is associated with.
- **willMove(to:)**: Called when the dynamic behavior is added to, or removed from, a dynamic animator.

## Behaviors

- **UIAttachmentBehavior**: A relationship between two dynamic items, or between a dynamic item and an anchor point.
- **UICollisionBehavior**: An object that confers to a specified array of dynamic items the ability to engage in collisions with each other and with the behavior’s specified boundaries.
- **UIFieldBehavior**: An object that applies field-based physics to dynamic items.
- **UIGravityBehavior**: An object that applies a gravity-like force to all of its associated dynamic items.
- **UIPushBehavior**: A behavior that applies a continuous or instantaneous force to one or more dynamic items, causing those items to change position accordingly.
- **UISnapBehavior**: A spring-like behavior whose initial motion is damped over time so that the object settles at a specific point.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Inherited By

- UIAttachmentBehavior
- UICollisionBehavior
- UIDynamicItemBehavior
- UIFieldBehavior
- UIGravityBehavior
- UIPushBehavior
- UISnapBehavior

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
